help.title: How to Use
help.subtitle: Learn how to create CSS animations with Animotion

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Animotion CSS helps you create CSS keyframe animations visually. You can start from scratch or use one of the built-in presets to get started quickly.

presets.title: Using Presets
presets.description: Click the 'Presets' button to choose from 15 pre-configured animations like fadeIn, bounce, slide, spin, and more. Presets are a great starting point that you can customize.

settings.title: Animation Settings
settings.durationDesc: How long the animation takes (100ms to 5000ms)
settings.timingDesc: The acceleration curve (ease, linear, bouncy, etc.)
settings.delayDesc: Time to wait before the animation starts
settings.iterationsDesc: How many times the animation repeats (or infinite)
settings.fillModeDesc: How styles apply before/after the animation

keyframes.title: Working with Keyframes
keyframes.description: Keyframes define the animation states at different points (0% to 100%).
keyframes.step1: Click on a keyframe to expand it and see available properties
keyframes.step2: Use checkboxes to enable/disable properties for that keyframe
keyframes.step3: Adjust values using sliders, inputs, or color pickers
keyframes.step4: Click 'Add Keyframe' to create new animation points

properties.title: Animatable Properties
properties.description: Each keyframe can animate different CSS properties:

preview.title: Preview
preview.description: Use the preview panel to see your animation in real-time. You can change the preview element shape (square, circle, text, icon) and use play/pause controls.

history.title: Saving & History
history.description: When you copy the CSS code, your animation is automatically saved to history. You can access saved animations from the History tab and apply them back to the editor anytime.
